activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12235
activity.text:
> > @rithviknishad @Jacobjeevan Iâ€™ve added a reset button to clear the selected location in both the create and edit facility forms. However, if a location has been added at least once, removing the selected location and submitting the form will not remove the location from the facility.
> > Please let me know if any changes are needed.
> 
> If I recall correctly, BE doesn't allow us to overwrite lat/log to undefined (once it's filled, hence why we added the fallback value). So, what would be the use case of a reset button here? ðŸ¤”
> 
> @nihal467 Instead, we can hide the show on map link if coords are 0/0, no? ðŸ¤”

@Jacobjeevan Yeah, we can't overwrite it once it's added. We can go with your approach as well, but the `reset` here is useful when you've filled the form, added the location, and want to clear it without closing the form and starting over.(not sure how significant that use case is, though)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12121
activity.text:
Hey @rithviknishad,
Due to the `freeInput` prop, the `CommandInput` retains the selected value when reopening the popover, which causes the dropdown to show only that option. If there's no specific need for this behavior, we can remove the condition that sets the CommandInput value from the selected option,it works fine after that.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12249
activity.text:
@karanziie1990 After logging in, click on any facility that has encounters. Do not go to the Associations tab.
Then, go to the Encounters tab and click on any encounter that is not completed. You will then see the option I mentioned in my first comment.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12249

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12249
activity.text: @karanziie1990 If you go to a specific encounter in a facility, you will see an option to `Add Questionnaire`, or you can check the `Quick Access` section on the right side to add a questionnaire.

activity.text:
@nihal467 Please review this PR and let me know if any changes are required.

- For now, Iâ€™ve temporarily added slots for the user `caresuperadmin` to select the appointment. This should be updated to the correct user once [this test](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/issues/10351) is merged.

- Also, each day should have only one slot per user. If multiple slots are available, the test will fail because the patient will attempt to book an appointment for the same slot.

Need to address the above things.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11339
activity.text:
@rithviknishad Can I take this up?  

**Approach:**  
- Create a **global unsupported state** using context or state.  
- On app load, check if the browser is unsupported:  
    - If unsupported and the alert has not been dismissed (use `localStorage` or `global state` to track this), show the alert dialog.  
    - After dismissal, update the state to avoid showing the alert again.  
- Keep the overlay tied to the global state so it persists across all soft navigations.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11304
activity.text:
**Hey @Rustix69,**  

This issue is happening because, in the last test of `PatientCreation`, a new encounter is being created for a patient and verified. However, someone created a new encounter for the same patient and left it as active.  

As a result, the test couldnâ€™t find a success toast for creating an encounter since the API is throwing an error for exceeding the limit of active encounters for that patient.  

I marked the encounter as completed, and itâ€™s working fine locally now. Letâ€™s try re-running the checks for your PR.  

By the way, it passed for the PR I raised after that.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11313
activity.text:
Hey @rithviknishad @Jacobjeevan, 

Please review this and let me know if any changes are required.  

- In the `EncounterQuestionnaire` page, should we display the active medications at the top and then show the inactive ones like we are showing in the other pages, or should we leave it as it is?  
- When I try to navigate to the `EncounterQuestionnaire` page from the organization view, it's showing a 404 not found error since this page is currently set up only for the Facility View, similar to the Treatment Summary Page. Should I add this page to the Organization View, or should we hardcode the facility view URL like the Treatment Summary Page?  

Please let me know your thoughts on the above two questions.

This issue is happening because, in the last test of `PatientCreation`, a new encounter is being created for a patient and verified. However, someone created a new encounter for the same patient and left it as active.  

As a result, the test couldnâ€™t find a success toast for creating an encounter since the API is throwing an error for exceeding the limit of active encounters for that patient.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11304
activity.text:
**Hey @abhimanyurajeesh,**  
If youâ€™re not working on this, can I take it up?  

**Approach:**  
- We can add a `line-through` class to the display name when the medication status is not active.  
- The edit button is currently only visible on small screens. Since both the edit and delete buttons are already disabled, we can either leave them as is or remove them if necessary.  

**ETA:** EOD  

Please assign me this @rithviknishad @Jacobjeevan and let me know if thereâ€™s anything else to consider.

activity.text:

## Implementation Steps

- **Check Existing Breadcrumbs** â€“ Review the breadcrumb logic in the Locations view and reuse the same pattern.  
- **Fetch Organization Hierarchy** â€“ Modify the query to fetch the organization's hierarchy.  
- **Generate & Render Breadcrumbs** â€“ Implement a function similar to `generateBreadcrumbs` for organizations and render it in the UI.  

**ETA:** By tomorrow EOD.
